subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: Note that the {{m|en|rice paddy}} meaning is specific to Japanese. The Chinese word for [[rice paddy]] is {{m|zh|水田}}.

subSections.title: Compounds
Etymology
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|た|yomi=k}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=た}}. Appears in the [[w:Kojiki|''Kojiki'']] written in roughly 711-712.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

subSections.title: Noun
Usage notes
subSections.text: The term ''ta'' can refer to either a wet field as for rice agriculture, or a dry field as for other crops. This term does not refer to a wild field or [[meadow]].

subSections.title: Derived terms
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|田圃|たんぼ}}, {{ja-r|田んぼ|たんぼ}}: a [[cultivated]] [[field]]
